cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north along Florida’s Gulf coast tonight, then turning north-northeast and accelerating toward southeast Georgia and the Carolinas during Wednesday-Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Big Bend coast (near Steinhatchee/Cedar Key)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch north of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC (Atlantic coast – well north of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning along Florida’s west coast Flamingo to Ochlockonee River and Georgia coast Mouth of St. Marys River to Altamaha Sound; Hurricane Warning Egmont Key to Steinhatchee River (all on Gulf side)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Main impacts along Florida’s west coast and subsequently Georgia–South Carolina coastline; east-central Florida (including Palm Beach) only affected by outer rainbands
weather_observation.wind: Brief gusty squalls possible Wednesday with low (≤7%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on Atlantic side of south-central Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with localized 6 inches possible in outer bands Wednesday, causing brief street/yard flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk in rainbands; hazardous seas and rip currents along adjacent Atlantic beaches
